location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

mods.abstract: Black and white reproduction of a map of Ash-Shehr [Ash Shihr], Yemen. The map is signed E M Little, 2nd Lieutenant of the Royal Garrison Artillery, and was drawn on 20 July 1902, at Steamer Point, Aden. The map shows the extent of the town’s walls, indicating its gates, and significant buildings within and without. Some surrounding topography is also indicated, as is the depth of the coastal waters, presumably stated in fathoms.
